**Bias Mitigation and Fairness**: AI models trained on human-generated data inevitably absorb societal biases. **Quality vs. quantity confusion:** Many people still think of teen jobs as just "flipping burgers" rather than recognizing that even basic jobs teach valuable skills when done in moderation.

You know what, that makes a lot of sense. It's like one of those things where the conventional wisdom just hasn't caught up to what we actually know.

Alright, I think I have what I need now. The data is pretty clear that 10-15 hours would likely benefit her, and she fits the profile where it should work well. Plus understanding why people are still resistant to it helps me anticipate what my spouse might say.

I really appreciate you cutting through all the noise and giving me the actual research. That's exactly what I was looking for - concrete evidence I can point to instead of just opinions and feelings.

Thanks for sticking with me even when I got frustrated with all the back-and-forth stuff earlier. Sometimes you just need someone to lay out the facts clearly.

<END>
